topic.title: HPE Helion 2.0 Development Platform: Messaging Integration for Administrators

ol.li:
Create a Message Broker RabbitMQ Cluster
Create a RabbitMQ cluster using the UI or the command line. You can configure using 1, 3 or 5 nodes. Make note of the username and password values as you will need them in following steps. You can also manage the RabbitMQ cluster to make changes in cluster configuration.

Configure HA Proxy for RabbitMQ cluster.
To provide a virtual IP address for the RabbitMQ cluster nodes, configure HA proxy for the RabbitMQ cluster nodes.

Configure ALS cluster for connectivity to RabbitMQ cluster.
Configure ALS cluster hosts and ports for access to the RabbitMQ cluster you have already created.
You need to open ALS access for the IP address of the RabbitMQ cluster, HA proxy VM, and each RabbitMQ node in the cluster on port 5672.

Provide the RabbitMQ connection information to app developers.
Provide the RabbitMQ cluster connection information and credentials to developers as explained here, such as:
Cluster name
HA Proxy IP address for the RabbitMQ cluster, and port number 5672
Username and password
The Connection string will be in the format:
amqp://<username>:<password>@<hostname>:5672/
